thread.title: Tottenham following Leicester's title blue-print by sharing the goals around, says Harry Kane
thread.title_full: Tottenham following Leicester's title blue-print by sharing the goals around, says Harry Kane

author: Darren Lewis
title: Tottenham following Leicester's title blue-print by sharing the goals around, says Harry Kane
text:
Kane and Alli are into double figures already, like Vardy and Mahrez (right) last season (Photo: Tottenham Hotspur FC/Getty) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
Harry Kane is confident his Tottenham side can use the formula that brought Leicester City glory to become champions themselves. 
The north Londoners have leapfrogged neighbours Arsenal, the two Manchester clubs and Liverpool to become the biggest challengers to league leaders Chelsea. 
Leicester were inspired to their sensational title win last season by 24-goal Jamie Vardy and Riyad Mahrez, who netted 17 times. 
Striker Kane , the top flight's current Golden Boot holder, has netted 13 times this season to lift his side into second. Team-mate Dele Alli is already on 10 for the campaign, Son Heung-min has hit six and Christian Eriksen is on five. Kane was the top flight's leading scorer in 2015-16 and has another 13 this term (Photo: Reuters) 
And England striker Kane believes the way Spurs are sharing the goals around bodes well for them to succeed where they failed last season — pushing Leicester into early May before taking just two points from their final four games to finish third. 
He said: “I think in any top team you need your striker scoring goals, and that’s what we’ve got in this league at the moment. But I think it’s important that you’ve got other players chipping in as well. 
"Dele Alli’s on 10 league goals already. If you’ve got two or three players getting 15-20 goals a season I think you’re going to be right up there. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
